ratings.comment: i never wore my seatbelt while driving to school because i wanted to die before making it to his class

Math 96 is meant to be an easy class. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case for me. I tried so hard to maintain a passing grade in the class but couldn't. He would always write the problems so disorganized. Also, he was aggressive that it made it difficult to get the help

Not as bad as everyone kind of makes it out to be. All you have to do is show up to class and dedicate some time out of class to process the lessons. Just show up to class and do the homework and you'll be fine. Make sure you study for tests.
He does not teach. He writes math topics on the board that are unorganized and difficult to understand. Worst experience I have had here. Very frustrating.

Get ready to teach yourself everything. This class is actually pretty hard for a precalc class and Rahul is not a good teacher. Homeworks are very long and often unnecessarily tedious, but I personally found the tests to be on the easier side. Attendance is mandatory because there is a quiz every class.
He is unintentionally funny solely because of how ridiculous some of things he does/says are. Not a great teacher though, makes stuff more confusing than it should be.

For Math 113: Professor is condescending at times to the point where I can barely contain my laughter. Does not help when I ask for help. Does not own up to his mistakes. Does not like to teach, which shows when we spend the majority of the time working on packets. Class is hard for the average student. He responds to your emails promptly though!

(This is for Math 113) Professor Mahajan can be condescending at times but sometimes it is funny. He does not take ownership of his mistakes and sometimes blames the math department. You get packets every class and those packets are mainly useless. If you do not have a solid math foundation, you are screwed. He answers emails promptly though!

This is for Math 113 but it wouldn't let me put it. He does not care about his students and does not even know what he is doing half of the time. He hands us packets and then just walks around and expects us to know how to do stuff. Kids who took AP Calc in high school are struggling in this class. Prepare to teach yourself everything.
Took him for stats, absolutely awful. New professor with absolutely no clear grading criteria. Sets the Average at a C, who does that?? Worst professor ever

Funny guy but really bad at teaching. Lectures are him reading confusing slides. Skip lecture and learn the topics online. Grading is super harsh and unfair. TA was not helpful and late to discussions.
I've never had a professor who cares less about teaching. The only thing he is good at is making easy topics hard.
Do not take a class with this professor. Listening to his lecture will leave you more confused than before.

I got a 98% in Diff Eq, yet I am struggling in this class more than any class I have ever taken. It starts out nice and easy but oh my gosh then he starts going to town talking about pointless and useless fancy sounding stuff.
DO NOT take ANYTHING with this professor.

DO NOT take THIS course with HIM! He read off of powerpoints for class, many times he was unprepared, not even looking through the slides beforehand. We had weekly tests on the readings that were extremely difficult and based on the smallest details. He did not explain things well at all. Take this course with someone else!!

The instructor demanded a lot from the students and the exams and papers were  challenging. But you learn tons! Although the instructor was very tough when grading, he gave the assignments a really generous curve. Feedback was thorough and helpful. I would recommend this class to anyone hoping to get a solid intro to classical social theory.
Absolutely hated the course. He taught it horribly. The tests were extremely hard and lectures were unhelpful yet mandatory. Do NOT take it with him if it is offered.

Do not take this class with him. Tests were so hard, even with cheat sheets. The tests were also longer than they should have been with very low averages. In class it was very hard to understand what he meant when explaining things. I would not recommend this class to other people.
